metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4658 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
xpointer.c in libxml2 before 2.9.5 (as used in Apple iOS before 10, OS X before 10.12, tvOS before 10, and watchOS before 3, and other products) does not forbid namespace nodes in XPointer ranges, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (use-after-free and memory corruption) via a crafted XML document.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4658` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxml2 - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.2
libxml2-utils - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.2
python-libxml2 - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libxml2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.2').
